text: [Applause]
okay it's time for a couple of poems
uh i've used the syllabic structure of
the football formation 442.
this is called love gone wrong i held
you close you look morose dead wasp
and this next poem is a five-lined haiku
a sang queen if you will
and in it i tried to sum up what it is
to live in the west we see such
chaos and destruction enter our lives
through the tv we feel upset by it but
we can't be upset all the time otherwise
we never take the bins out
so we have to distract ourselves with
the mundane the sensual the kutidin
this is the paradox of western existence
in this mad world spun fast for nothing
lives fly past helplessly we look on
aghast oh cake
when i was a kid when i was learning the
piano i always preferred
the minor keys the major key is always
associated with happiness
but i prefer the more melancholy minor
key the mutable minor scales
like the melodic minor
that hopeful ascent and depressing
descent things are looking happy and
joyful no they're not they're depressing
and bleak
and the wonderful harmonic minor with
that eastern figure at the end
it's impossible to play that without
playing it like this
[Music]
that's right
with grey three and when i'm in a social
situation people say bill is someone's
birthday
will you play the piano and i say i will
will you play happy birthday i said i'll
do it in the minor key
[Music]
then i got a list
big cabaret
i've rewritten the lyrics to happy
birthday because i think happy birthday
is a bit of a dirge
so it's also too unrealistic this is
more downbeat
and realistic this is happy birthday in
the style of the 1930s berlin cabaret
in the curt vile birthday if you will
happy birthday happy birthday
what a rhapsody of fear
let's drum the harp of pointlessness
you've survived another
year
each little candle a tiny death knell
a snickering footman a tolling
bell one for deception
and one for a crime and one
for a dream extinguished by time
our lives are briefed shuffled down the
gang blank of pain
till we're just an old sponge cake left
out in the rain
stumbling to oblivion from embryo to
ghost
so let's charge our dirty glasses and
raise a
futile toast to you
and your meaningless milestone of decay
[Applause]
happy birthday happy birthday
like anybody cares
it's a lie it's a lie it's a lie it's a
lie
it's a cake in the shape of a lie
why use that knife to cut the cake why
here's the
reaper's side happy birthday
cheeky chops it's not every day you're
[Music]
five
bye
you
